answers.answer: http://www.medhelp.org/forums/neuro/messages/33704.htmlis a good link that has a long discussion on sciatica and fusion, with that person with burning in feet.Enoch Choi, MD
Yes!  I have burning feet and it mostly affects my big toes in the first joint. Very painful at times.
I'm sorry your feet are burning too.  It's worth going to get it checked out by a neurologistEnoch Choi, MD

My mother of 78 years has this problem its called nueroapathy( or something ) of the bottom of the feet. People who smoke and or suffer from Diabetes and may also be or are overweight, causes this problem. It's the nerves in the soles of the feet, and there's not much you can do about it but try whatever you can, herbal, Homopathaic, Western, although she has had no relief and she doesn't smokeor overweight but does live with a diabetic!!!! but she isn't.
